intro: Sibthorpia nectarifera, commonly known as the nectar-bearing sibthorpia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are palmately lobed and often have a hairy texture. Sibthorpia nectarifera is known for its ability to thrive in arid environments, making it an important species in dryland ecosystems.
